title: Linker errors when building `wasm32-wasi`

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
First, I tried to use `tokio` when compiling in `wasm32-wasi` with `rt`, `time` features And got:
rust-lld message

``` rust-lld: error: function signature mismatch: _ZN5tokio7runtime4task4core11TaskIdGuard5enter17h6a97b9fd17627a62E defined as (i64) -> i64 in ..\deps\wasm.2e227afycm7gw02n.rcgu.o defined as (i32, i64) -> void in ..\deps\libtokio-e32be7e448bee767.rlib(tokio-e32be7e448bee767.tokio.be9105f8-cgu.0.rcgu.o) rust-lld: error: function signature mismatch: _ZN5tokio7runtime4task5waker9raw_waker17h7cf8396c921ccb61E defined as (i32) -> i32 in ..\deps\wasm.2e227afycm7gw02n.rcgu.o defined as (i32, i32) -> void in ..\deps\libtokio-e32be7e448bee767.rlib(tokio-e32be7e448bee767.tokio.be9105f8-cgu.0.rcgu.o) rust-lld: error: function signature mismatch: _ZN5tokio7runtime4task5state5State21unset_join_interested17he39960ef09ad9f2aE defined as (i32) -> i32 in ..\deps\wasm.2e227afycm7gw02n.rcgu.o defined as (i32, i32) -> void in ..\deps\libtokio-e32be7e448bee767.rlib(tokio-e32be7e448bee767.tokio.be9105f8-cgu.0.rcgu.o) ```

I then tried to implement a small custom executor, but ran into the fact that `std` uses `hashbrown`: ```rust #[no_mangle] pub extern "wasm" fn foo() { let x = HashMap::::new(); } ``` And I got:
rust-lld message (not so scary)

``` rust-lld: error: function signature mismatch: _ZN3std3sys4wasi19hashmap_random_keys17hb926006eb278ce27E defined as () -> i64 in ..\deps\wasm.2eimp74zrlub6rxs.rcgu.o defined as (i32) -> void in ..\.rustup\toolchains\nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-msvc\lib\rustlib\wasm32-wasi\lib\libstd-0cc507706e4a1289.rlib(std-0cc507706e4a1289.std.e0347f5c-cgu.0.rcgu.o) ```

I was also getting similar errors when I didn't spell `#[inline]` to some functions that others delegated? Why would something like this happen. Is this a rust error or am I doing something wrong? ---- I also thought about upgrading, but that didn't work, so I now have
nightly 1.70 ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (4a04d086c 2023-03-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: 4a04d086cac54a41517d5657b59d5fe2caca2d71 commit-date: 2023-03-18 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.0 ```
